thread.title: Former Flyers attending fundraiser to help memorial program in teen's honor
thread.title_full: Former Flyers attending fundraiser to help memorial program in teen's honor

author: Sam Carchidi
title: Former Flyers attending fundraiser to help memorial program in teen's honor
text:
Former Flyers attending fundraiser to help memorial program in teen's honor Updated: February 21, 2017 — 4:02 PM EST 5 Share 
John LeClair, Keith Primeau, Kimmo Timonen, and Chris Therien will make appearances, along with Lou Nolan, the team’s public-address announcer. 
’s team. All funds raised will benefit the Wissahickon Skating Club's memorial program in the young man’s honor. 
Brain injury has had an impact on my life and hearing about the loss of Nick was truly devastating," Primeau said. “As a former hockey player and more importantly a father, I felt such empathy and compassion for the Bond family and wanted to do anything possible to help." 
Nick was a fiery and skilled competitor who believed success on and off the ice was built on teamwork and friendship. He was, without question, the epitome of what we want most in our children,” said Kevin Hamel, the Wissahickon Skating Club president and a family friend.
